Package pulse.ui

Class Launcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.ui.Launcher
  • public class Launcher
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the main class used to launch PULsE and start the GUI. In addition to providing the launcher methods, it also provides some functionality for accessing the System CPU and memory usage, as well as the number of available threads that can be used in calculation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static double CPUUsage()
      This will calculate the CPU load for the machine running PULsE.
      static double getMemoryUsage()
      This will calculate the ratio totalMemory/maxMemory using the standard Runtime.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Launches the application and creates a GUI.
      static void showProblemStatementFrame()
      Invoked when the respective frame component needs to be shown on screen.
      static void showSearchOptionsFrame()
      Invoked when the respective frame component needs to be shown on screen.
      static int threadsAvailable()
      Finds the number of threads available for calculation.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launches the application and creates a GUI.

      • showProblemStatementFrame

        public static void showProblemStatementFrame()
        Invoked when the respective frame component needs to be shown on screen.

      • showSearchOptionsFrame

        public static void showSearchOptionsFrame()
        Invoked when the respective frame component needs to be shown on screen.

      • getMemoryUsage

        public static double getMemoryUsage()

        This will calculate the ratio totalMemory/maxMemory using the standard Runtime. Note this memory usage depends on heap allocation for the JVM.

        Returns:
        a value depicting the memory usage

      • CPUUsage

        public static double CPUUsage()

        This will calculate the CPU load for the machine running PULsE. Note this is rather code-intensive, so it is recommende to use only at certain time intervals.

        Returns:
        a value depicting the CPU usage

      • threadsAvailable

        public static int threadsAvailable()
        Finds the number of threads available for calculation. This will be used by the TaskManager when allocating the ForkJoinPool for running several tasks in parallel.
        Returns:
        the number of threads, which is greater or equal to the number of cores
        See Also:
        TaskManager
